intro: Capuronianthus vohemarensis, commonly known as the Vohemarensis hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
